description: New Zealand and the US have pledged to work more closely together on common challenges, in a further sign that Wellington is re-aligning itself with traditional western partners as China becomes more assertive in the Pacific.
title: New Zealand, US Pledge Closer Ties Amid China Tension in Pacific

description: Keir Starmer vowed Labour will preserve the UK’s nuclear deterrent if it’s voted into power, underlining how much he’s changed the opposition party since replacing Jeremy Corbyn as leader.
title: Starmer Promises Labour Will Preserve UK’s Nuclear Deterrent

description: US officials met secretly this week with members of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro’s administration to keep him engaged in negotiations over democratic reforms as a deadline nears to reinstate sanctions against the nation’s oil industry.
title: US and Venezuela Secretly Meet in Mexico as Oil Sanctions Deadline Nears

description: President Joe Biden said he was committed to “deepening maritime and security ties” with Japan and the Philippines as he sought to assure allies worried about increasingly assertive Chinese actions in disputed waters.
title: Biden Vows to Back Japan, Philippines as China Rattles Allies

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Big Take DC senior producer Naomi Shavin previews the podcast about how the steelworkers union is flexing it’s muscle in the takeover bid for US Steel. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: A Political Fight Over Steel and Union Votes in the 2024 Election

description: US federal agencies were ordered to analyze emails, reset compromised credentials and work to secure Microsoft Corp. cloud accounts amid concerns that a Russian nation-state hacking group may have accessed some correspondence.
title: US Warns Agencies of Possible Breach Via Microsoft Hack

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said his forces launched an attack that destroyed the largest power generating plant in the Kyiv region in retaliation for assaults against his own country’s energy sector.
title: Putin Says Russia Forced to Respond to Ukraine Energy Attacks

description: Donald Trump won’t be deposed on Monday after all in the case filed against him by two co-founders of his social-media startup, a person familiar with the matter said, resolving questions over a potentially significant conflict with the start of the former president’s first criminal trial.
title: Trump Deposition in SPAC Suit Scrapped Ahead of Criminal Trial

description: French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal defended the European Union’s trade deal with Canada during a visit to Ottawa, saying he had faith it would move forward in his country despite a setback in the Senate.
title: France’s Attal Says EU-Canada Trade Deal Is a ‘Win-Win’ For All

description: Credit traders at Barclays Plc and HSBC Holdings Plc are among those making a market for clients to bet against the debt of Thames Water amid an escalating crisis at the UK’s largest water utility.
title: HSBC, Barclays Are Making Markets for Thames Water Short Bets

description: Russia’s missile attacks on Ukraine’s energy system, the bombardment of its second-largest city and advances along the front are stoking worries that Kyiv’s military effort is nearing breaking point.
title: Russian Attacks on Ukraine Stoke Fears Army Near Breaking Point

description: Mexico’s state oil company Petroleos Mexicanos, in conjunction with the government of Mexico City, is investigating reports of contaminated water in some parts of the city, President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said in a morning press briefing Thursday.
title: Pemex, Mexico City Inspecting Water Contamination, AMLO Says

description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said the world needs the US to maintain its key role on the global stage, warning that Ukraine would lose hope and much of Asia would face “harsher realities” without American support.
title: Kishida Says ‘World Needs US,’ Warning Congress of Global Risks

description: Peter Magyar, who’s seeking to take on Hungary’s nationalist Prime Minister Viktor Orban, said his bid to register for European Parliament and municipal elections has been approved.
title: Orban Opponent Peter Magyar Gets Green Light to Run in Elections

description: The European Union is moving toward approval of Ukraine’s reform plan in May, which would unlock an additional €1.9 billion ($2 billion) as part of a total €15.9 billion that the bloc has planned in financial aid for Kyiv for this year.
title: EU Eyes Ukraine Reform Approval in May in Bid to Unlock More Aid

description: Mexico is calling for Ecuador’s expulsion from the United Nations for violating diplomatic norms by raiding its embassy in Quito last week.
title: Mexico Seeks Ecuador’s Expulsion From the UN Over Embassy Raid

description: The European Union should tap Russia’s frozen assets to help Ukraine as using just the windfall profits is not enough, Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Thursday.
title: Poland’s Tusk Urges EU to Tap Frozen Russian Assets for Ukraine

description: The bribery trial of US Senator Bob Menendez will begin May 6 as scheduled, but his wife’s case will be delayed until at least July because of an undisclosed medical problem that requires surgery.
title: Bob Menendez Bribery Trial to Start May 6 Without Ill Wife

description: The Biden administration is growing even more frustrated with both congressional Republicans and allies in Europe over delays in funding Ukraine’s fight against Russia, people familiar with the matter said, as concerns mount that Russian forces could make major gains in the coming weeks.
title: US Frustration Mounts as Ukrainian Weapon Stocks Run Out

description: Investments in artificial intelligence by Alphabet Inc.’s Google, Apple Inc., and Microsoft Corp. warrant deeper scrutiny from the UK’s antitrust watchdog over concerns they are being leveraged to further entrench their market power.
title: Big Tech’s ‘Interconnected Web’ of AI Investments Concerns UK’s CMA

description: The United Nations atomic watchdog held an emergency meeting in Vienna to discuss the increasing risk of an accident at a Russian-occupied atomic power plant in Ukraine.
title: Ukraine Nuclear-Plant Attacks Prompt Emergency Watchdog Meet

description: France dropped a plan to write medium-term energy targets into law amid a political rift between opponents of nuclear and renewable energies in the nation’s parliament.
title: Political Rift Forces France to Drop Law for Energy Targets

description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius compared Russian President Vladimir Putin’s war on Ukraine to Adolf Hitler’s annexation of Czechoslovak territory in 1938 and said Europe should prepare for a large-scale Russian attack.
title: German Defense Chief Compares Putin to Hitler at Churchill Event

description: The European Union shouldn’t fund further programs until countries have gotten their finances in order, German Finance Minister Christian Lindner said.
title: Germany’s Lindner Says No Need for Further European Debt

description: Iran may be close to launching missile or drone strikes on Israeli targets in response to a deadly attack on its diplomatic compound in Syria last week. Yet how the Islamic Republic retaliates is more complicated than the why.
title: Iran Has No Easy Options as It Seeks to Avenge Damascus Attack

description: The UK’s largest water and sewage supplier Thames Water is in trouble. A huge hole in its finances is threatening to drive the company to temporary nationalization, potentially creating a big problem for current or future governments. Here’s an explainer of how Thames Water came to be in this position, what could happen if the company collapses and what it all means for customers.
title: Thames Water Debt Crisis: Will it be Nationalized? Will Bills be Affected?

description: Maryland Governor Wes Moore said all options — including private partnership and tapping capital markets — are under consideration to finance the rebuild of the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore if the federal government is unable to cover the costs as originally promised.
title: All Funding Options ‘On the Table’ for Baltimore Bridge Rebuild

description: It’s perhaps the only hot-button issue on which Donald Trump plays defense. It has forced even MAGA acolyte Kari Lake to ask Democrats for help. And just last month, it lost the Republicans a state seat in otherwise ruby-red Alabama.
title: Abortion Is Becoming the Biggest Weakness for Trump and the GOP

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s new newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: Robust Indian Economy Fuels Modi’s Electoral Juggernaut

description: The danger of a cut to France’s credit rating is adding to the challenges facing President Emmanuel Macron as he’s forced to juggle his budget in the run-up to June’s European Union elections.
title: Danger of a Ratings Hit Turns Up the Budget Pressure for Macron

description: South Africa is heading into unchartered political terrain and investors are growing increasingly anxious.
title: South Africa’s Looming Political Shakeup Has Investors on Edge

description: Hungary will postpone some state investments in a bid to stop the budget deficit from exceeding an already raised target, Finance Minister Mihaly Varga said Thursday.
title: Hungary to Delay $1.9 Billion in Investments to Control Deficit

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: A South Africa Where the ANC Doesn’t Rule Alone

description: National Health Service waiting lists fell for a fifth month in England, but the number of patients waiting for treatment still remains higher than when Prime Minister Rishi Sunak promised to reduce it.
title: NHS Waiting Lists Decline, But Still Fall Short of Sunak Promise

description: Poland and Hungary, former political allies that are now at opposite ends of the spectrum, rejected contentious new European Union legislation on the hot-button issue of migration.
title: EU Migration Deal Triggers Strong Pushback From Orban, Tusk

description: Russia launched a new rocket on its third attempt this week, a much-needed success for its struggling space program after two last-minute cancellations.
title: Russia’s New Rocket Takes Off After Two Scrapped Launch Attempts

description: Moldovan President Maia Sandu is facing rising domestic tensions ahead of key elections this year as protests in another Russia-friendly region — besides the breakaway Transnistria enclave — fuel concerns that Moscow is intensifying pressure to derail the nation’s pro-European path.
title: Moldova’s President Faces Protests as New Pro-Russia Front Opens

description: The largest power plant in the region surrounding the Ukrainian capital was destroyed in a Russian missile attack.
title: Ukraine Says Russia Destroyed Kyiv Region’s Largest Power Plant

description: The Biden administration is issuing a rule designed to close a gap that allows gun buyers to avoid background checks, in what officials are touting as one of the most significant steps to crack down on unlicensed dealers in decades.
title: Biden Administration to Issue Rule Closing Gun-Show Loophole

description: US President Joe Biden is set to unveil joint military patrols and training with the Philippines and Japan as the allies seek to counter an increasingly assertive China in the South China Sea.
title: US Ramps Up Ties With Japan, Philippines to Counter China at Sea

description: A crucial power plant south of Kyiv was destroyed by an overnight Russian missile attack, Interfax reported.
title: Ukrainian Power Plant Destroyed in Russian Missile Attack: IFX

description: Deutsche Lufthansa AG has suspended services to Tehran amid an escalation in tensions in the Middle East.
title: Lufthansa Suspends Services to Iran Amid Rising Tensions

description: Ukraine’s parliament approved a mobilization law that seeks to recruit more troops to fight back Russian forces after more than two years of war, a lawmaker said.
title: Ukraine Approves Mobilization Law to Bolster Military Ranks

description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin will dole out almost $14 billion in cash handouts as his government seeks to jumpstart growth in an economy that’s lagged behind most countries in Southeast Asia.
title: All About Thai PM’s $14 Billion Cash Handout to Reignite Growth

description: The latest China-funded infrastructure project in Washington’s crosshairs is a proposed canal in Cambodia.
title: US Urges Transparency Over China-Backed Canal in Cambodia

description: Tesla Inc.’s Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk is set to visit India and meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, sparking speculation about the US company’s investments in the South Asian nation just ahead of the start of national elections.
title: Musk to Meet Modi, Spurring Tesla India Investment Speculation

description: Julius Malema, leader of South Africa’s leftist Economic Freedom Fighters, says he can offer investors something the country’s current rulers lack: clarity, consistency and transparency.
title: Leftist EFF Vows Investor Clarity Before South African Election

description: China’s unofficial ban on imports of live Australian lobster will likely be lifted as relations between the two nations continue to warm, the South China Morning Post reported, citing a source with knowledge of the matter.
title: China to Lift Australian Lobster Import Ban, Morning Post Says

description: The US has added four Chinese companies to an export blacklist for buying US-origin goods to support China’s military modernization efforts, the Department of Commerce said in statement published Thursday.
title: US Blacklists Four More Chinese Firms for Helping Boost Military

description: Russia fired high-speed ballistic missiles at Ukraine on Thursday morning, targeting the country’s capital and western region that borders Poland.
title: Russia Targets Kyiv, Western Ukraine in Ballistic Missile Strike

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi made a case for the country’s digital payments system to reach the US, saying it would benefit the large Indian diaspora, tourists and students, according to an interview he gave to Newsweek.
title: Modi Seeks Peaceful Border With China, Wants UPI to Expand to US

description: About two years after winning South Korea’s presidency, Yoon Suk Yeol is already looking like a lame duck.
title: Big Loss Turns Pro-Business Yoon Into Lame Duck in South Korea

description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s government is facing its biggest test of unity yet as lawmakers begin a debate on relaxing Poland’s restrictive abortion law.
title: Tusk’s Bickering Coalition Faces Test in Polish Abortion Debate

description: The US and Japan unveiled plans to deepen their security ties as President Joe Biden hosts Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida for an official visit that shows Japan’s importance as a key ally in countering China.
title: Biden Upgrades Defense Ties With Japan Aimed at Countering China

description: There’s no reason for China to “overreact” to the joint maritime patrol by the US, Japan, Australia and the Philippines in the disputed South China Sea, a White House advisor said.
title: US Says No Reason for China to ‘Overreact’ to Drills with Allies
